Package slogo.view

Class SLogoMenuBar

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.control.Control
javafx.scene.control.MenuBar
slogo.view.SLogoMenuBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable
public class SLogoMenuBar
extends javafx.scene.control.MenuBar
Populates the system default menu bar on MacOS devices. Detects the operating system, and if the system is MacOS, creates a menu bar with various menus and options such as open, save, or open new window. Many of these options can have keyboard combinations attached to them. This class extends MenuBar and will determine whether the system is Mac at construction. Menus can then be added using the String names of the menu stored in a ResourceBundle.

  • Constructor Details

    • SLogoMenuBar

      public SLogoMenuBar​(javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> handler)
      Constructs an instance of a SLogoMenuBar, which has all menus described in the menuBar.properties file. This constructor also needs an EventHandler to connect buttons to their functionality.
      Parameters:
      handler - an EventHandler for buttons to take effect.

  • Method Details

    • makeMenuFromProperties

      private javafx.scene.control.Menu makeMenuFromProperties​(java.lang.String menuName)
      Creates a Menu with all corresponding MenuItems from a properties file. An String input is needed for the name of the menu. This method will then look in the properties file for all menu items for this menu, and add them as children to this menu. This will invoke makeMenuButton to create menu item buttons as well as their EventHandler.
      Parameters:
      menuName - name of the top level menu to create
      Returns:
      a Menu object complete with menu items connected to event handlers.

    • makeMenuButton

      private javafx.scene.control.MenuItem makeMenuButton​(java.lang.String property)
      Creates a menu button using data from a resource bundle. The ID of the MenuItem created will also be used by reflection later to invoke methods.
      Parameters:
      property - the property name of the button being created
      Returns:
      a MenuItem with a label, an ID, and an event handler
